Title: libxslt: Denial of service
Synopsis:
Multiple Denial of Service vulnerabilities have been found in
    libxslt.

Background.Text: libxslt is the XSLT C library developed for the GNOME project. XSLT is an XML language to define transformations for XML.

Description.Text:
Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in libxslt:

  • Multiple errors exist in pattern.c and functions.c (CVE-2012-2870, CVE-2012-6139).
  • A double-free error exists in templates.c (CVE-2012-2893).
  • A NULL pointer dereference in keys.c (CVE-2012-6139).
  • An error in handling stylesheets containing DTDs (CVE-2013-4520).

Impact.Text: A remote attacker could entice a user to process a specially crafted file in an application linked against libxslt, possibly resulting in a Denial of Service condition.

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time.

P.Text: All libxslt users should upgrade to the latest version:

Packages which depend on this library may need to be recompiled. Tools
      such as revdep-rebuild may assist in identifying some of these packages.
